Package net.tangly.ui.canvases

Class CanvasRenderingContext2D

java.lang.Object
net.tangly.ui.canvases.CanvasRenderingContext2D
public class CanvasRenderingContext2D extends Object
The context for rendering shapes and images on a canvas.

This is a Java wrapper for the same client-side API.

  • Method Details

    • setFillStyle

      public void setFillStyle(String fillStyle)

    • setPatternFillStyle

      public void setPatternFillStyle(String src, String type)
      Set a pattern to use as a fill style. Must reference an image source previously loaded with Canvas.loadImage().
      Parameters:
      src - the path to the image resource
      type - the pattern repeat type (see the Canvas API)

    • setStrokeStyle

      public void setStrokeStyle(String strokeStyle)

    • setPatternStrokeStyle

      public void setPatternStrokeStyle(String src, String type)
      Set a pattern to use as a strok -style. Must reference an image source previously loaded with Canvas.loadImage().
      Parameters:
      src - the path to the image resource
      type - the pattern repeat type (see the Canvas API)

    • drawImage

      public void drawImage(String src, double x, double y)
      Fetches the image from the given location and draws it on the canvas.

      NOTE: Unless you have previously loaded the image with Canvas.loadImage, the drawing will happen asynchronously after the browser has retrieved the image.

      Parameters:
      src - the url of the image to draw
      x - the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the image
      y - the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the image

    • drawImage

      public void drawImage(String src, double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Fetches the image from the given location and draws it on the canvas.

      NOTE: Unless you have previously loaded the image with Canvas.loadImage, the drawing will happen asynchronously after the browser has retrieved the image.

      Parameters:
      src - the url of the image to draw
      x - the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the image
      y - the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the image
      width - the width for the image
      height - the height for the image
